title: Rescue Mission
opening: The coup d’etat at Aquleia quickly spread out to the rest of Etruria. Calling themselves the Revolutionaries, the coup d’etat forces sought to ally with Bern and divide rulership of Elibe.
Cecilia escaped from Aquleia with Guinevere. Forming an anti-coup d’etat militia called the Loyalists, she traveled around Etruria, fighting the Revolutionaries.

However, the Revolutionaries had Bern on their side. With King Mordred taken hostage, Great General Douglas and Knight General Percival were also forced to join the Revolutionaries. With these powerful allies, the Revolutionaries slowly began to push the Loyalists out of Etruria. Eventually, the Loyalists were driven into an old castle on Misul Peninsula.

After locating Cecilia, Roy headed for Misul. Meanwhile, the Loyalists were under joint attack by the Revolutionaries and Bern’s troops. It would only be a matter of time before the Loyalists were defeated…

intro.speaker: Narcian
intro.line: Flaer! Hasn’t the castle gone down yet!?

intro.speaker: Flaer
intro.line: General Narcian, the Loyalists led by General Cecilia are fighting harder than we had anticipated...

intro.speaker: Narcian
intro.line: Cecilia...! That bitch again! Always interfering with my plans...!

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: I see you are having trouble, Narcian.

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: Just now. The general from Etruria fights well, I see.

intro.speaker: Narcian
intro.line: Y-Yes... But fear not, I shall force her into submission...

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: No, let me. I will fight her myself.

intro.speaker: Idunn
intro.line: Your Majesty, there is no reason for you to fight...

intro.speaker: Zephiel
intro.line: No matter, I need the exercise. Narcian, show me to her.

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: The castle hasn’t fallen yet, Master Roy.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Good! But we still have to hurry.

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: So... You are Cecilia, the Sorcery General.

battle.speaker: Cecilia
battle.line: !! ...King Zephiel...

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: For your prowess in battle, you have the honor to fight me one on one.

battle.speaker: Cecilia
battle.line: Too...powerful...

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Down already? I would have expected more.

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: Your Majesty! Invincible as always.

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: I suppose this is all one can expect from an Etrurian General.

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: Your Majesty... If you would allow it, may I have her?

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Hm?

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: I have some certain...bad memories with this woman. I want to punish her for them.

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Hmph, very well. Do with her as you wish.

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: Thank you very much, Your Majesty. You there, make one of the prison cells ready.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Yes, General Narcian.

battle.speaker: Percival
battle.line: What? Bern is attacking the castle?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Yes, General Percival.

battle.speaker: Percival
battle.line: ...This isn’t what they promised. They said that they would leave Etrurian matters to us Etrurians.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: What should we do?

battle.speaker: Percival
battle.line: Was it General Narcian who commanded the attack?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: No, sir. It was King Zephiel himself.

battle.speaker: Percival
battle.line: ! The king himself... So, Bern had no intention of entrusting anything to us in the first place... We aren’t going to move right now. Tell everyone to remain at their posts.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Yes, sir.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: The castle fell?

battle.speaker: Merlinus
battle.line: Yes... We were too late.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: Is General Cecilia all right?

battle.speaker: Merlinus
battle.line: There is no report that she was killed, but probably...

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: Well, if there’s still a possibility that she’s alive, then I won’t give up. We have to hurry!

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: Your Majesty! We have found Princess Guinevere.

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Bring her to me.

battle.speaker: Guinevere
battle.line: Zephiel...

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Guinevere. So good to see you.

battle.speaker: Guinevere
battle.line: Zephiel, why? Why did you start this war... Why are you killing innocent people?

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Innocent, you say? Hmph, jealousy, vanity, greed... People have been fighting over such rubbish in any nation. And you call them innocent?

battle.speaker: Guinevere
battle.line: Well...

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: The world must liberated from such pointless things that men fight over. That is the purpose of this war.

battle.speaker: Guinevere
battle.line: But...people are being brutally killed in the process.

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: No radical change can come about without sacrifice.

battle.speaker: Guinevere
battle.line: Zephiel...!

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Guinevere, you are my only sister. Therefore, I will forgive you this time. But not the next. Do you understand?

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Narcian! Wasn’t the leader of Guinevere’s guards here?

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: Yes. Her name is Melady.

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Very well. Tell her to escort Guinevere back to Bern. Also tell her to make sure that the Fire Emblem is returned to the Temple of Seals.

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: Yes, Your Majesty.

battle.speaker: Guinevere
battle.line: Zephiel...

battle.speaker: Guinevere
battle.line: Melady...

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: Princess Guinevere, I am glad to see you safe. Now, let us return to Bern on my mount... ...Princess?

battle.speaker: Guinevere
battle.line: Melady!

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: Wh-What are you doing!? Please put down that sword before you are hurt!

battle.speaker: Guinevere
battle.line: Melady, please! Let me go.

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: ! ...Should I oblige, what would you do next?

battle.speaker: Guinevere
battle.line: ...I understand that Roy of the Lycia Alliance Army is near here...

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: !? You would join the enemy!?

battle.speaker: Guinevere
battle.line: If we don’t do something, Elibe will be overrun by Bern’s forces... No matter what kind of reasoning my brother gives, what he is doing is obvious. He is forcing others into submission through power. I cannot agree that that will lead to anything good...

battle.speaker: Guinevere
battle.line: Melady... Please. Let me go.

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: ...There is one thing...

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: There is one thing that I cannot forgive you for, Princess. When you left Bern earlier, why did you not come to consult me...?

battle.speaker: Guinevere
battle.line: Well... I thought that your reputation would be damaged, so...

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: ! Did you think that I would prioritize my reputation above you? I am your loyal knight more than I am a knight of Bern. That has not changed ever since I was knighted.

battle.speaker: Guinevere
battle.line: Melady...

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: If you told me to let you go, then I would follow your order with pleasure.

battle.speaker: Guinevere
battle.line: Melady... Thank you.

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: Please, halt your attacks! I am not an enemy!

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: What? Everyone, lower your weapons!

battle.speaker: Merlinus
battle.line: Master Roy, she may be lying...

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: She may be a messenger. Killing a messenger goes against the knight’s code.

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: Are you General Roy?

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: ...Yes. And you are?

battle.speaker: Guinevere
battle.line: Roy!

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: Princess Guinevere!? You were safe.

battle.speaker: Guinevere
battle.line: Yes... I escaped with her assistance.

battle.speaker: Melady
battle.line: My name is Melady.

battle.speaker: Guinevere
battle.line: Roy, General Cecilia is alive.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: R-Really?

battle.speaker: Guinevere
battle.line: Yes, she is alive, although she is severely wounded. She is being held captive in the castle.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: Thank you! We have to rescue her!

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Are they ready?

battle.speaker: Idunn
battle.line: Yes. The Dragons are prepared to fight at your command.

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Narcian, I will give you some Dragons to fortify your militia. I want you to send some of your forces to Nabata.

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: Nabata? The desert lands located at the center of this peninsula?

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Right. I hear that there is a hidden village in which Dragons have been staying ever since the Scouring.

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: I see... Then there is a high chance that a Divine Weapon is hidden there.

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Exactly. It must not fall into the hands of the enemy. I already sent some troops to start the attack, but they are outnumbered.

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: Understood, Your Majesty. I shall send some mercenaries and Dragons there at once.

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: Good. You can also take the girl we captured in Nabata. She’s a Shaman from the hidden village. You can pry more information out of her if you need to.

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: Yes, Your Majesty. I shall have the village taken in no time.

battle.speaker: Zephiel
battle.line: ...I shall remember those words.

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: Of course!

battle.speaker: Cecilia
battle.line: ...Oh... Where am I... ...!

battle.speaker: Sophia
battle.line: You’re still not well... You shouldn’t move...

battle.speaker: Cecilia
battle.line: Did you treat my wounds?

battle.speaker: Sophia
battle.line: ...Yes... But I’m not...used to treating wounds... Perhaps...I didn’t do a good job...

battle.speaker: Cecilia
battle.line: Yes, you did. Thank you. We must find a way out of here... ...Ow...!

battle.speaker: Sophia
battle.line: You shouldn’t move... The wound...will open again...

battle.speaker: Cecilia
battle.line: But I must do something...

battle.speaker: Sophia
battle.line: It will be all right... I can see...a light...that will soon be here to help us...

battle.speaker: Cecilia
battle.line: Light?

battle.speaker: Sophia
battle.line: Yes... That light...will aid us both... We must wait for it...

battle.speaker: Cecilia
battle.line: Who are you...?

battle.speaker: Sophia
battle.line: I am Sophia... A priestess of Arcadia...

battle.speaker: Cecilia
battle.line: Arcadia?

battle.speaker: Sophia
battle.line: I shall tell you more about it...later... For now...please trust me...

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Yes, what is it, General Percival?

battle.speaker: Percival
battle.line: We’re leaving.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: What? Are you sure?

battle.speaker: Percival
battle.line: Bern’s behavior is clearly an act of insult to Etruria. I cannot aid Bern any further. We will return to Aquleia and inform Lord Douglas of this matter. Retreat at once!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Yes, sir!

battle.speaker: Flaer
battle.line: General Narcian! It’s them! The Lycia Alliance Army!

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: What!? Flaer! I thought you had taken care of them at Djuto!

battle.speaker: Flaer
battle.line: I did! Well...I left a Dragon to deal with them, so... I never thought that they had survived!

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: What!? You fool, then my reputation as your officer is also in jeopardy! If I let the Lycia Alliance Army live here, people will start to suspect my ability... I must do something... ...But, they defeated a Dragon. They seem to be tougher than I expected.

battle.speaker: Flaer
battle.line: General Narcian... What should we do...?

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: I have no choice... Flaer, I will return to Aquleia and plan an attack on the Alliance Army. You stay here.

battle.speaker: Flaer
battle.line: ! M-Me... Stay here?

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: You don’t have to defeat them. I just want you to hit them as hard as you can and decrease their numbers.

battle.speaker: Flaer
battle.line: General Narcian! You would use me as a cannon-fodder!?

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: Flaer... To tell you the truth, you would have been executed a long time ago when you failed to defend Djuto. I’m giving you a chance to prove your worth again. You should be grateful. Hehehe...

battle.speaker: Flaer
battle.line: But!

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: Or do you want me to carry out your execution right here?

battle.speaker: Flaer
battle.line: ...! ...Yes...sir... Understood.

battle.speaker: Narcian
battle.line: Good. Then I’ll leave the rest to you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Elffin
recruit-talk.line: Percival. It is good to see you again.

recruit-talk.speaker: Elffin
recruit-talk.line: Have you forgotten my face?

recruit-talk.speaker: Percival
recruit-talk.line: No...it cannot be. The prince...is dead.

recruit-talk.speaker: Elffin
recruit-talk.line: ...I understand your confusion. After all, a man who was pronounced dead is now standing before your very eyes.

recruit-talk.speaker: Percival
recruit-talk.line: Prince Mildain! You were alive...?

recruit-talk.speaker: Elffin
recruit-talk.line: I have troubled you for a long time now. ...It has been over a year since I was assassinated.

recruit-talk.speaker: Percival
recruit-talk.line: Assassinated!? Your Majesty, did you not fall off your horse in an accident?

recruit-talk.speaker: Elffin
recruit-talk.line: No. I was shot with a poisoned arrow. First to my horse...and then to me.

recruit-talk.speaker: Percival
recruit-talk.line: No...

recruit-talk.speaker: Elffin
recruit-talk.line: Douglas noticed first and made it public that I had been killed. A different corpse was placed in the coffin, and everything was set up as if the assassination had been successful. Douglas then entrusted me to his adopted daughter and let me escape to the Western Isles.

recruit-talk.speaker: Percival
recruit-talk.line: Lord Douglas did that...

recruit-talk.speaker: Elffin
recruit-talk.line: Even after I escaped to the west, I suffered from a high fever caused by the poison for many months. I was hovering between life and death so long that Douglas’ daughter gave up hope countless times.

recruit-talk.speaker: Elffin
recruit-talk.line: The rebel forces helped me by giving me medicine. Ironic, isn’t it? The very rebels who were fighting against the Etrurian court had saved the life the prince himself!

recruit-talk.speaker: Elffin
recruit-talk.line: I recovered...slowly. And then I saw the horrors being committed by the Etrurian nobles on the Isles. I was ashamed that I had not noticed when I was still residing on the throne.

recruit-talk.speaker: Percival
recruit-talk.line: Your Majesty...

recruit-talk.speaker: Elffin
recruit-talk.line: While aiding the rebels, I was looking for a chance to return to the mainland. Then General Roy came along, and I saw my chance. And that is how I ended up here.

recruit-talk.speaker: Percival
recruit-talk.line: Prince... I am truly thankful that you returned alive.

recruit-talk.speaker: Elffin
recruit-talk.line: I am with the Lycia Alliance Army right now, but I still must hide my true identity. And if I still have the loyalty that you pledged to me in the past...

recruit-talk.speaker: Percival
recruit-talk.line: I am at your service, Your Majesty. My master is only one, and he is you, Prince Mildain.

recruit-talk.speaker: Larum
recruit-talk.line: General Percival! It is you, isn’t it? I was looking for you! I am...

recruit-talk.speaker: Larum
recruit-talk.line: Wait! Wait! Stop your horse! Listen to me!

recruit-talk.speaker: Percival
recruit-talk.line: Who are you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Larum
recruit-talk.line: Don’t you know!? I thought we’d met before.

recruit-talk.speaker: Percival
recruit-talk.line: ...I sort of recall seeing you at Lord Douglas’ manor...

recruit-talk.speaker: Larum
recruit-talk.line: Yes! That’s me. You do know me, then!

recruit-talk.speaker: Percival
recruit-talk.line: But the girl I saw there was a little more...ordinary.

recruit-talk.speaker: Larum
recruit-talk.line: What’s that supposed to mean? Ah, no matter. Anyway, my name is Larum. I’m here under the command of Prince Mildain.

recruit-talk.speaker: Percival
recruit-talk.line: Prince Mildain...? Don’t be daft. The prince was killed in an accident the year before.

recruit-talk.speaker: Larum
recruit-talk.line: Well... Look at this!

recruit-talk.speaker: Percival
recruit-talk.line: !! That emblem... It belongs to the prince...!

recruit-talk.speaker: Larum
recruit-talk.line: Now do I have your attention? Then take a look at this letter, too. The prince told me to give it to you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Percival
recruit-talk.line: ...... This is the prince’s handwriting... So he is alive! Then I hesitate no more. If the prince has joined the Lycia Alliance Army, then I must do the same.

recruit-talk.speaker: Larum
recruit-talk.line: Wha-? That was quick... I was hoping things to get more dramatic... Like, ‘If you’re still going to stand against us, then you’re going to cut me down first!’ or something like that...

boss.speaker: Flaer
boss.line: Damn…! But I am a knight of Bern! I shall never surrender!

boss.speaker: Flaer
boss.line: Remember this… There are…plenty of warriors greater than I… Bern’s army shall annihilate you…for sure…

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: General Cecilia!

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: Roy... I have made a fool out of myself in front of you.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: No, of course not! I am relieved that you are alive... But what of your wounds? Are you all right?

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: Yes. This girl treated them for me.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: And you are?

end.speaker: Sophia
end.line: I am Sophia... A priestess of Arcadia...

end.speaker: Cecilia
end.line: She prophesized that you would be coming. Now, you said you would tell us more once we were safe...

end.speaker: Sophia
end.line: Yes... Arcadia...our home...lies to the east...in the Nabata Desert... We tried to stay hidden...but Bern found us... And...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: They attacked you?

end.speaker: Sophia
end.line: Yes... I was too slow...so I was captured...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I see... But why would Bern be interested in a little hidden village like yours?

end.speaker: Sophia
end.line: I...do not know... Perhaps...they found out...about the Dragons that live in Arcadia...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Dragons!?

end.speaker: Sophia
end.line: Yes... Arcadia...was built a long time ago...by Dragons and people who wished to live together...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Such a place existed...?

end.speaker: Sophia
end.line: Master Roy... Please, save our village...!

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: But the story does seem a bit unbelievable...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...In any case, it’s probably true that her village is under attack by Bern. We should help them. We owe Sophia anyway because she helped General Cecilia.

end.speaker: Sophia
end.line: ...Thank you...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Then, can you tell us more about your village and the Dragons?

end.speaker: Sophia
end.line: Yes... I will gladly tell you what I know...

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: General Percival, until further instructions are given, we will station ourselves in this castle and prepare for further attacks from the Revolutionaries.

end.speaker: Percival
end.line: Good.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Here, we found this in the castle. Please take it. General Percival, please take care...of Etruria.

end.speaker: Percival
end.line: I know. Leave it to me.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Yes!
